intro: Hibbertia fasciculiflora, commonly known as the clustered false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has hairy, branching stems and oval-shaped leaves with toothed margins. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Hibbertia fasciculiflora is an important plant for local pollinators and has been used in traditional Aboriginal medicine.
